headline: Bitcoin extends rally, AbbVie earnings beat, Phillips 66 miss
summary: As part of today's Market Minute, Julie Hyman examines some of the top stories investors are watching. Bitcoin (BTC-USD) climbs above the $95,000 mark as investors weigh macroeconomic uncertainties. AbbVie (ABBV) stock gains after reporting strong first quarter results and lifting its 2025 profit forecast. Phillips 66 (PSX) shares fall after announcing a wider-than-expected loss in the first quarter. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Phillips 66, Boston Beer, Charter Communications: Trending Tickers
summary: With the trading session underway, Catalysts host Madison Mills and Yahoo Finance Markets Reporter Josh Schafer examine some of today's trending tickers. Phillips 66 (PSX) announces a wider-than-expected first quarter loss amid pressure from activist investors. Boston Beer Company's (SAM) first quarter earnings results beat expectations, but the company warned of a tariff impact of up to $30 million in 2025. Charter Communications's (CHTR) first quarter sales came in better than expected, with customer losses narrowing year over year. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here.

headline: Phillips 66: Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: HOUSTON (AP) — Phillips 66 (PSX) on Friday reported first-quarter earnings of $487 million. The Houston-based company said it had net income of $1.18 per share. Losses, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, came to 90 cents per share.

raw.headline: Phillips 66: Q1 Earnings Snapshot
raw.summary: HOUSTON (AP) — Phillips 66 (PSX) on Friday reported first-quarter earnings of $487 million. The Houston-based company said it had net income of $1.18 per share. Losses, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, came to 90 cents per share.

headline: US refiner Phillips 66 posts bigger-than-expected quarterly loss as margins bite
summary: (Reuters) -Phillips 66 reported a bigger-than-expected loss for the first quarter on Friday, hurt by lower refining margins amid widespread turnaround activities across the U.S. refining sector, sending its shares down over 2%.  "Our results reflect not only a challenging macro environment, but also the impact from one of our largest-ever spring turnaround programs," said CEO Mark Lashier.  Phillips 66's refining unit posted a net loss of $937 million for the first quarter, compared with a year-ago profit of $216 million.
